str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Superlative of elachus; used as equivalent to mikros; least.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From hiko; competent, i.e. Ample or fit.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: (a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name. Akin to the base of keleuo; to 'call'.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
On this account, because, for. From dia and hoti; on the very account that, or inasmuch as.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
